title: This machine knows if you're going to die - and might just save your life
text:
American doctors have designed an advanced super computer which can predict the likelihood of a person's death with almost 100% accuracy.
The Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center in Boston has linked up all its poorly patients to the machine, which is said to be better at spotting illnesses than human doctors.
It is loaded with information about more than 250,000 people from the past 30 years, drawing on this data to make speedy diagnoses.
This speedy disease recognition could allow a quick cure, potentially saving lives as well as predicting patients' imminent demise.
Getty Docs vs death: Could a computer make a better diagnosis than a human?
Dr Steve Horng told the BBC : "Our goal is not to replace the clinician.
"This artificial intelliegence is really about the augmenting of doctors' ability to take care of patients."
It collects data on patients every three minutes, measuring everything from oxygen levels to blood pressure to give doctors "everything we need to know about a patient".
When the computer says no, you should probably start saying your prayers.
"We can predict with 96% confidence when patients [are facing a high] probability of dying," Dr Horng continued.
"If the computer says you're going to die, you probably will die in the next 30 days."
